revised_title: The Agricultural Value of Rainfall in the Tropics: Forecasting Crop Yields
tldr: This article explores the agricultural value of rainfall in the tropics and how it can be used to forecast crop yields. The author develops a method to evaluate rainfall and its impact on plant growth, focusing on the relationship between rainfall and crop yields in the tropics. The study finds that effective rainfall, a measure of the fraction of rainfall available for plant growth, is a significant factor in determining agricultural success in the tropics.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Agriculture and Climate
